image.altText: A woman with a little girl sitting on her lap

items.synopsis: Many working Australians simply won't have enough to make ends meet each week, according to new research provided exclusively to the ABC's The Drum.

title.children: Working Australians struggling to afford basic needs, new data shows

image.altText: Liberal Senator David Van

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says Senator David Van has been advised he will not sit in the Liberal party room after receiving further allegations against him following a statement made by Senator Lidia Thorpe in the Senate.

title.children: Peter Dutton dumps Senator David Van from Liberal party room

image.altText: A picture of the outside of a business in an industrial area

items.synopsis: A teenage boy dies from his injuries after an incident on Thursday morning at the factory where he worked in Perth's south-east.

title.children: Teenager fatally injured at industrial business in Perth is latest in spate of WA workplace deaths

image.altText: A cow stands beneath an irrigation pivot which has been knocked over in a storm

items.synopsis: When Scott Fraser arrived at Pardoo Station from inland Queensland, he was not expecting to face one of Australia's most severe cyclones.

title.children: Multi-million dollar clean-up continues after 'mind-boggling' damage to Pardoo Station

image.altText: A small room with two bare single beds on either side, with a stainless steel basin and toilet in the foreground.

items.synopsis: A controversial and initially temporary facility that separates some youth detainees from Western Australia's main juvenile detention centre will remain open at Casuarina Prison for longer than first planned.

title.children: Policy of housing juveniles in WA adult prison to continue indefinitely

image.altText: Man working from home in a creative field on his ipad

items.synopsis: Unemployment surprisingly falls back to 3.6 per cent, as an estimated 75,900 jobs are added to the economy.

title.children: Economists tip more rate hikes as jobs numbers smash expectations

image.altText: a surfer on a large wave

items.synopsis: Unstable weather off southern WA could see huge swells pounding the coast from Augusta to Albany today.

title.children: Forecast huge swells prompt warnings for sightseers, excitement for surfers on WA coast

image.altText: A man in glasses and a suit stands between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags.

items.synopsis: A lease held by the Russian Federation for an embassy close to Parliament House has been cancelled by the federal government.

title.children: Government rushes through law to stop new Russian embassy being built near Parliament House

image.altText: Aerial footage of the Train's home showing two front steps and water tanks.

items.synopsis: A pre-inquest coronial hearing outlined the investigation will focus on what led to the murder of two police officers and a neighbour at Wieambilla last year.

title.children: Wieambilla neighbour recorded moment he was shot without warning by extremists, court hears

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt leans over as though looking for something.

items.synopsis: The man who helped launch a fresh search for clues in a homicide investigation in the West Australian outback is hopeful his work might lead police towards answers.

title.children: Family friend who found 'jigsaw piece' to reignite outback murder probe hopes police can finish job

image.altText: Motorbike on tow truck

items.synopsis: Police and community leaders say parents have a major role to play in combating dangerous, illegal trail bike riding both offroad and on residential streets.

title.children: Parents urged to help as surge in illegal motorbike riding grips South West city

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

items.synopsis: Australia needs an ambitious national project to fix our housing crisis, researchers say.

title.children: Australia's housing policies make 'the wealthiest the most subsidised cohort' and experts say that needs to change

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

items.synopsis: Stronger than expected jobs data has some economists predicting another interest rate rise will be imminent, while New Zealand's economy has entered a recession.

title.children: Risk of interest rate rise increases as unemployment rate drops to 3.6pc, ASX finishes higher — as it happened

image.altText: A digital illustration of a boy wearing headphones playing a video game online

items.synopsis: A former WA police officer says early discussions about cyber safety are essential, as younger children using apps and games are being approached by cybercriminals online.

title.children: Parents warned of sextortion scammers targeting children as young as 10

image.altText: Woman and young child look at a pile of floral tributes lid at the site of the Hunter Valley bus crash

items.synopsis: As part of a joint operation, NSW Police and the National Heavy Vehicle Regulator have inspected vehicles and documents at the bus depot of the company involved in the deadly bus crash in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Buses, documents, driver management under police spotlight in wake of Hunter Valley tragedy

items.synopsis: It was a Sunday afternoon in Port Arthur in 1996 when the three people Walter Mikac loved most were brutally taken from him.

title.children: Nine days after Walter lost his entire family, he sent a letter that helped change the course of Australian history

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and smiling stand side by side in front of a glass window

items.synopsis: The South Australian Labor government has sought to address housing affordability woes and skyrocketing cost-of-living pressures in its second budget.

title.children: Stamp duty relief and billions poured into hospitals in South Australian budget

image.altText: Man wearing straw hat and black singlet holding crayfish on stern of boat

items.synopsis: In a packed courtroom in Far North Queensland, a man demonstrates how he allegedly gunned down his 'best mate' with a semi-automatic rifle.

title.children: Man holds gun in packed courtroom to demonstrate how he allegedly killed his 'best mate'

image.altText: Woman with curly dark hair and black singlet smiles for the camera on a beach.

items.synopsis: The parents of Simone Strobel, murdered in Lismore in 2005, hope a second inquest into her death will proceed now charges against her then-boyfriend have been withdrawn.

title.children: Parents of murdered backpacker feel 'no closer' to answers after charges withdrawn

image.altText: A man wearing a black cap fixes the collar of Trump's white jumper.

items.synopsis: Many of the familiar faces that surrounded Donald Trump in his final days in the White House have exited his orbit. But there is one man who remained dutifully by his side — and his loyalty may have made him a target of the FBI.

title.children: How the man who was constantly by Trump’s side ended up in court as his co-defendant

image.altText: Dan Bourchier kneels down next to Miriam-Rose Ungunmerr Baumann\

items.synopsis: We travelled thousands of kilometres, navigated croc-filled waters and an encounter with a deadly taipan to record the stories of Indigenous Elders on Country for the ABC's One Plus One program.

title.children: What does it mean to be on Country with Indigenous Elders? Dan Bourchier reflects on a moving assignment

image.altText: A man in a suit walks as a microphone is held in his path

items.synopsis: Closing addresses are underway in the case in which Hillsong founder Brian Houston has pleaded not guilty to concealing his father's abuse of a young boy.

title.children: Hillsong founder's 'only focus' was to protect church after father's sexual abuse, court hears

image.altText: Man with grey hair and glasses holds a silver coloured trophy cup in two hands

items.synopsis: As the annual Country Week football competition approaches, the competition's first-ever trophy — awarded to Geraldton 111 years ago — has turned up in an unexpected spot.

title.children: 'An incredible find': Shed clean-out unearths piece of WA footy history

image.altText: A pregnant woman using a mobile phone

items.synopsis: Many Australians use phone apps to help track their periods, for convenience, contraception or to better understand fertility and reproductive health, but privacy experts warn they're not without risk.

title.children: Many Australians use period-tracker apps for convenience, but experts warn they could come at a cost

image.altText: A large red dot sits on a northern island of a map of the Philippines.

items.synopsis: The Philippine seismology agency says it expects damage and aftershocks in the quake's aftermath.

title.children: Magnitude 6.2 earthquake strikes northern Philippines, tremors felt in Manila

image.altText: A large crowd a gathers for a protest in daylight, with someone holding aloft a photo of smiling young woman.

items.synopsis: At least five pregnant women have died due to the restrictions on abortion, according to activists, while the leader of Poland's ruling party says: "There is no such issue. It's been made up."

title.children: 'Stop killing us': Polish women protest against strict anti-abortion law

image.altText: Aerial view Couran Cove Island resort

items.synopsis: Cheap waterfront properties are listed for sale at Couran Cove near the Gold Coast, but the real estate ads leave out an important detail — they have no power or water.

title.children: It's advertised as a 'resort-style paradise', but real estate ads ignore the fact it has no power or water

image.altText: Young male migrants standing on a boat waiting for rescue.

items.synopsis: At least 79 migrants drown, with hundreds more said to be missing after their overloaded boat capsized and sank off Greece, in one of Europe's deadliest shipwrecks in several years.

title.children: At least 79 dead, hundreds more missing after Greece's deadliest shipwreck in years

image.altText: Aboriginal people in a NT community - generic image

items.synopsis: Life outcomes for Indigenous Australians are continuing to worsen, as initiatives to Close the Gap offer mixed outcomes in the pursuit of ending systemic disadvantage.

title.children: Government says updated Closing the Gap data highlights need for structural change

image.altText: New Zealand trees down

items.synopsis: New Zealand is experiencing a recession after two quarters of negative GDP growth to March 2023, according to data released by Stats NZ.

title.children: New Zealand slips into shallow recession as bad weather takes toll

image.altText: Plastic bags full of meth.

items.synopsis: Federal police have pulled off one of Australia's biggest drug busts, seizing six tonnes of liquid and crystal meth that was hidden in shipments of canola oil bottles destined for Melbourne.

title.children: Charges laid over 'eye-watering' meth bust that stopped $1.7 billion worth of drugs from reaching Australia

image.altText: A man wearing a light blue suit looks out the corner of his eyes as he walks up steps

items.synopsis: Kurtley Beale will stand trial after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in the bathroom of a hotel in Sydney's eastern suburbs.

title.children: 'The truth will come out': Wallabies star Kurtley Beale pleads not guilty to sexual assault

image.altText: A calico cat with orange, black and white fur in a bush.

items.synopsis: Halls Gap residents face a fine if caught with a cat as part of a ban that has spanned three decades.

title.children: This tiny town banned residents from owning cats 30 years ago to protect native wildlife. But did it work?
